title: BaileyJakob
author: BaileyJakob
content: Hi all,This is my first post on here - woohoo! My name is Bailey, a 25-year-old Bitcoin Enthusiast since 2015. I am the founder of mrsatoshi.com, bitbyte.news, and thebitcoinlegacyproject.orgAt the beginning of this month, I announced my upcoming book Orange Pill'd - An anthology of 250 individual Orange Pill'd stories from fellow Bitcoiners in 72 different countries.Here is a short rundown of what the book is about:"Orange Pill'd is a captivating exploration of the human experience in the digital age. It is a powerful anthology that brings together 250 Orange Pilled stories from Bitcoiners around the world, revealing the transformative impact of the world's most revolutionary digital currency, Bitcoin.From tales of financial freedom and empowerment to accounts of challenges and personal growth, Orange Pill'd takes you on a journey through the lives of individuals who have been forever changed by their encounters with Bitcoin. Each story is presented on a single page, accompanied by a hand-drawn illustration that adds an intimate, diary-like feel to the collection.Discover how Bitcoin has sparked a global movement, uniting people from diverse backgrounds and experiences in their quest for a more decentralized, transparent, and equitable financial system. With a mix of inspiring, heartwarming, and thought-provoking stories, Orange Pill'd offers a unique window into the hearts and minds of those who have dared to embrace the promise of a better future.Whether you are a seasoned B﻿itcoin enthusiast or a complete beginner, Orange Pill'd invites you to delve into the personal narratives that define this groundbreaking movement and to share in the triumphs, challenges, and dreams of those who have been Orange Pill'd."I am really excited for this book and hope you find it interesting!You can learn more about my book & pre-order it too at orangepilldbook.com - you get a 30% discount for pre-ordering & can obviously pay with BTC & LightningAdditionally, here is a free 28-page sample of the book for you.https://publuu.com/flip-book/138614/352040/page/1  The book comes out on July 31 on Amazon, Kindle, and Barnes & Nobles.I would love any feedback or commentary on your thoughts, and I am also happy to answer any questions you may have  If you want to connect on Twitter - I am always eager to follow more Bitcoiners. twitter.com/baileyjakob1Thanks all & keep stacking!

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: You also join in contributing your best qota to the bitcoin community and the world at large by bringing up a reading material that can help others learn and develope themselves in bitcoin, there are so many books, videos and articles already created by many online and in stores for purchase while some are free for downloads, i will advise you to keep it up, share as many as you can freely if you're capable, encourage for more adoption and continue the good works, i believe you will still have may to discover frombthe forum here about some aspects of bitcoin.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Greetings and congratulations on your first post on this forum.This is a bit unusual for a bitcoin enthusiast since 2015. Haven't you heard anything about bitcointalk all this time and didn't you have a desire to look here? If these figures are accurate, then you have been addicted to cryptocurrencies since the age of 17?I like the title of your book, referring to the famous pills from "The Matrix" and the color of the BTC logo. Indeed, a very good analogy. If it wasn't for that, I wouldn't have spent any merit on you.Now closer to the point. How did you manage to find out these 250 stories about bitcoiners from around the world? I mean how did you know about it? Did you know them personally? It would be instructive to know a little about the history of writing your book.I'll add a picture of your book, taken from your website, containing pricing information.And I also found information about a giveaway with a prize fund of $3000. I don't know why you kept silent about it. I'll also add a picture from your website.Also worth mentioning is the payment method with bitcoin for your book. I'm sure this community will approve and appreciate it. It would be very strange if this payment option did not exist. So, I wish you all the best and successful sales.

I find nothing wrong in some bringing up a book that's crypto-currency related for the community to see, infact I am eager to read the book and gain from it if there are things there for me to gain, I think his approach is very honest, he claimed ownership of the book, he would have easily said here is a book he is expecting and give us an intro to it and you won't be saying he was promoting his book.Knowledge of Bitcoin and trying to help expose us to helpful stuffs like in this case his book should go beyond ranks, time on the forum or level so long as the OP sticks to the rules, my personal suggestions is for the op to read the rules and other helpful beginners post first.

comments.author: BaileyJakob
comments.body: Quote from: m2017 on May 23, 2023, 04:30:08 PMQuoteGreetings and congratulations on your first post on this forum.This is a bit unusual for a bitcoin enthusiast since 2015. Haven't you heard anything about bitcointalk all this time and didn't you have a desire to look here? If these figures are accurate, then you have been addicted to cryptocurrencies since the age of 17?Thank you for the kind feedback, I appreciate it  Correct, I first bought Bitcoin in 2015 on Coinjar, when I was 17 years old and have been involved since then.I have known about this forum since 2015, I just never felt compelled to join (mostly because I didn't feel like I had a lot to offer as a 17/18 year old). Then, as the Twitter Bitcoin community began growing - I found my place within the community there.QuoteI like the title of your book, referring to the famous pills from "The Matrix" and the color of the BTC logo. Indeed, a very good analogy. If it wasn't for that, I wouldn't have spent any merit on you.Now closer to the point. How did you manage to find out these 250 stories about bitcoiners from around the world? I mean how did you know about it? Did you know them personally? It would be instructive to know a little about the history of writing your book.So, to gather these Orange Pilled stories, I posted on Twitter in April asking people to submit their Orange Pill story via an online submission form & they would be rewarded 1,000 Sats for doing so. I did not mention it was directly for a book (I just said it was for an upcoming project), the reason for this was to keep the stories genuine and to avoid anyone submitting an exaggerated story because they knew it would be published in a book. Then, over the course of 3 weeks, I received 538 submissions. I then organised them into categories and constructed a collection of 250.Here is the original tweet - https://twitter.com/BaileyJakob1/status/1647628162732531714QuoteAnd I also found information about a giveaway with a prize fund of $3000. I don't know why you kept silent about it. I'll also add a picture from your website.Glad you mentioned this! The reason I did not originally mention this in my post is because I knew if I just info dumped everything at once and was promoting something, encouraging purchasing, and then also mentioning giving away $3,000 - it would quickly be flagged as scammy or not genuine. So, I left out the giveaway, for somebody to find and mention and then I would discuss it (like now) haha.Not much more to dive in for the giveaway as the image says it all - but yes, 3 people who pre-order my book will each win $1,000 USD (paid via LN). I personally give away Sats regularly on Twitter, and my business Mr. Satoshi also has a monthly 1.5m Sats giveaway + instant Sats back on all orders via LNURLw - so, the giveaway is very much legit and a common practice for me and my various projects.QuoteAlso worth mentioning is the payment method with bitcoin for your book. I'm sure this community will approve and appreciate it. It would be very strange if this payment option did not exist. So, I wish you all the best and successful sales.Exactly right - You can checkout via Bitcoin & the Lightning Network.Thank you very much
